unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Sample Size and Significance: Who Has the Greatest Power?
question_text: In a hypothesis test, ${ H }_{ 0 }:p=0.8$ versus ${ H }_{ a }:p>0.8$ the power of the test $p=0.8$ would be the greatest for which of the following choices of sample size $n$ and significance level $\alpha $ ?

choices.text: It cannot be determined from the information given.

solution:
Power is the probability of correctly rejecting the null hypothesis.

It will occur when the significance level is the largest as the null hypothesis will have a higher probability of being rejected. Choices 'A' and 'B' can be eliminated.

Regarding the sample size, the power will be the greatest when the sample size is the largest. The reason for this is with a larger sample size we will be more likely to correctly reject the null hypothesis. Choices 'C' and 'E' can be eliminated.

It occurs when the sample size and the significance level are the largest. Therefore, our answer is Choice 'D'.

Note: to have the greatest power, we always want the largest significance level and sample size.
